cab.content: From Secretary of State to Viceroy, 21st April 1917.(Repeated to Sir P. Cox.) - .-.Foreign Secret. Cox's telegram of 8th April. Egyptian civil officers for Mesopotamia. Appointment of Clayton is being proceeded with at once but designation will be held over as proposed by Cox. Unless Cox sees strong objection it.is also proposed to proceed with appointment of officers named in Wingate's telegram No. 443 16th April, repeated to Cox. His Majesty's Government consider Knox more suitably employed at Basra as at present.
